meanings.sent1: I tend to overlook small details when I'm in a hurry.
meanings.sent2: Don't overlook the importance of double-checking your work.
meanings.sent3: It's easy to overlook the humor in his jokes when you're feeling serious.
meanings.sent4: She tends to overlook the negative comments and focus on the positive ones.
meanings.sent5: If you overlook the warning signs, you might end up in trouble.

meanings.definition: A place where one can have a view from above
meanings.sent1: The hotel room had a beautiful overlook of the city skyline.
meanings.sent2: The hiking trail led to a stunning overlook of the valley below.
meanings.sent3: The overlook at the park was a popular spot for picnics and photos.
meanings.sent4: From the overlook, you could see the entire town spread out below.
meanings.sent5: The overlook provided a breathtaking view of the sunset over the mountains.

meanings.definition: To look down on from above
meanings.sent1: The eagle soared high above, ready to overlook its prey below.
meanings.sent2: The castle was strategically built to overlook the surrounding lands.
meanings.sent3: The cat liked to overlook the backyard from the top of the fence.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse was positioned to overlook the rocky coastline.
meanings.sent5: The balcony overlooked the bustling city streets below.
